intro: Mauria subserrata, commonly known as the serrated mauria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, giving it its scientific name. Mauria subserrata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
